Dear Ms. Williams:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
02/24/2022. The study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Implementation Sustainability Exit Plan
(ISEP) requirements. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the ISEP and your contract. As indicated above substantial compliance has
been established therefore, your license is renewed.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS

2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional MSA requirements except for the following:
Compliance found.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
Compliance found.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 When contractual therapists are utilized a criminal history clearance and central
registry clearance is required for their personnel file.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas: None at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Mott Children Residence submitted two acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
 2021C0217026 cited R 400.4157 (3) and R 400.4127 (3).
Staff pulled a youth’s arm to get her off the road. A medical assistant transported two
youths when one of the youths was on a one staff to one youth ratio in this incident.
Therapeutic Crisis Intervention refresher was completed by Mott Children Residence
staff and disciplinary action was issued. Compliance is met.
 2021C0221026 cited R 400.112.
An employee began working before the applicable out of state clearance check was
completed. Mott Children Residence human resource tracking system now includes
when CWL-1326 clearance forms are returned to Whaley Children Center for
prospective employees. The human resource director verifies clearances received
prior to hire. Compliance is met.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
